div.p: The ECSCM-Repo plugin allows ElectricCommander to communicate with your Repo, to download Git repositories. This plugin enables you to perform code checkout, preflight actions, and continuous integration.
Note: Repo must be installed and must be accessible from the command line.

Supported tool version
This plugin was developed and tested with Repo version 1.7.4.3.
To enable Commander to communicate with Repo, create a Source Control configuration, supplying the following information:

ul.li: Configuration Name - Provide a unique name for the configuration, keeping in mind that you may need to create additional configurations over time.
Description - You can supply a text description for your reference only. Commander does not use this information.
Manifest repository URL - The url from which to retrieve a manifest repository. For the Android project it is git://android.git.kernel.org/platform/manifest.git
Manifest - The manifest file within the repository defined in the previous field. If no manifest name is selected, the default is default.xml
Mirror the repositories - Select this option to create a local mirror of the repositories.

div.p: See the Commander online help system for details about how to use this plugin within a procedure.
When you provide information for this plugin, fill-in the fields as follows:

ul.li: dest - Indicate the path relative to the job's workspace where the source tree will be created.
RepoAgentPath - Select this option if you created a property called "repo_working_dir" in the resource to avoid downloading the entire repository each time.
RepoProjectList - Specify a list of projects to be downloaded.
RepoBranch - Specify the git branch to fetch from repo.
repoworkdir - Supply the path to the developer working directory.
agentworkdir - Supply the path to the source directory used by the agent.
RepoBranch - Specify the git branch to fetch from repo.
RepoAgentPath - Select this option if you created a property called "repo_working_dir" in the resource to avoid downloading the entire repository each time.
RepoBranch - Indicate the git branch to watch.
